basic_info.description: I'm Elizabeth, an aspiring software development in Seattle. After attending law school for two years, I realized that while I enjoy thinking analytically, I want to use that logic to build things rather than argue with other lawyers. Since I began programming, I've discovered that being a software developer requires the right combination of analytical problem-solving and creativity. I'm particularly enthusiastic about front-end applications because I have an eye for design and functionality. My goal is to find a position where I can continue to create and learn with the same intensity that I have been over the past 3 months.

projects.title: EZ-PC Shopper
projects.description: My final project for Code 201. I collaborated with three talented classmates to create a website that allows shoppers to build their own PC.

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: During my Code 201 course, I designed and deployed a website to meet the needs of an imaginary cookie store: Pat's Salmon Cookies. This project incorporated UI design and the internal code to calculate sales data from all of Pat's cookie stores.

projects.title: Bus-Mall
projects.description: This is a project from my Code 201 class. I created a web app to do consumer research for an imaginary catalogue called BusMall. The site displays 3 randomly generated products each round. When the user chooses their preferred product, their clicks and views are recorded and then displayed in a graph after 25 rounds.
